block.p: LEAD: Explaining Last Summer's Drought The 1988 drought was caused by cyclical changes in the tropical Pacific and had little to do with the greenhouse effect, new evidence indicates. With an improving understanding of the global climate system, scientists have linked cold waters off South America to storms and atmospheric disturbances that drove the jet stream northward, causing drought in North America.
